intro: Bones are not just hard sticks; they are living 'factories' that produce blood cells.
notes: Red Bone Marrow: Found in spongy bone; it makes Red Blood Cells.
Yellow Bone Marrow: Found in the center; it stores fat and makes White Blood Cells.
Compact Bone: The hard outer part that stores Calcium and Phosphorus.
Cartilage: Smooth tissue at the ends that reduces friction.
